| ! [![Pink potion.png](/images/7/79/Pink_potion.png)](/wiki/File:Pink_potion.png) |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                             | hallucination                                                 |
| Appearance                                                                       | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                                       | 100 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                                           | 20                                                            |
| Monster use                                                                      | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

A **potion of hallucination** is a type of potion that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.5 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [6.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [6.7 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may be given a potion of hallucination as any of the three random potions in their starting inventory.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Potions of hallucination make up 1⁄25 (4%) of all randomly-generated potions. General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and liquor emporiums can sell potions of hallucination.

[Mixing](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy") a [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze") with a [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") or a [potion of gain energy](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_energy "Potion of gain energy") creates a potion of hallucination.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

- *Main article: [Hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination")*

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") the potion causes [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination"), with the duration dependent on the potion's [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"): blessed potions cause the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") to hallucinate for 300–499 turns, uncursed potions cause hallucination for 600–799 turns, and cursed potions cause hallucination for 900–1099 turns.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Dipping a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") into a potion of hallucination turns it into uncursed [water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Mixing a potion of [healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing"), [extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing"), or [full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing") with a potion of hallucination will create water.

Inhaling [vapors](/wiki/Vapors "Vapors") from a potion of hallucination will print a message with no other effect, followed by prompting the player to type-[name](/wiki/Name "Name") the potion.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

[Hallucination resistance](/wiki/Hallucination_resistance "Hallucination resistance"), which is only granted by wielding [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir"), suppresses the effects of the potion of hallucination and other sources instead of blocking or curing it outright.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Drinking a non-cursed potion of hallucination may now give [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment"), which exercises [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom"); wielding Grayswandir also blocks this effect. The chance of gaining enlightenment is 4⁄9 for a blessed potion and 1⁄6 for an uncursed potion.

## Strategy

Potions of hallucination tend to have relatively few uses, as there are more reliable ways to confuse hostile monsters, and there are even fewer benefits to quaffing them directly - as such, they are generally considered prime candidates for [dilution](/wiki/Dilution "Dilution"). However, hallucinating while being hit by a [touch of death](/wiki/Touch_of_death "Touch of death") prevents it from killing the hero, which can make the potions life-savers against hostile high-level spellcasters for a hero that has not yet obtained [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

## History

The potion of hallucination first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

## Messages

- Oh wow! Everything \<looks/feels> so cosmic!

  You are hallucinating - "feels" is used if you are also [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") at the time.

- You have a momentary vision.

  You inhaled vapors from a broken potion of hallucination.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") has a 2⁄5 chance of generating a cursed potion of hallucination within the Chamber of Junk.

Hallucination in SLASH'EM also distorts items in the hero's inventory and on their square are standing on, which makes randomly quaffing potions far more hazardous; additionally, it is still only a minor problem in the eyes of their [deity](/wiki/Deity "Deity"). Be sure to have the inventory letter of your remedy memorized: in addition to unicorn horns and potions of extra healing or full healing, [medical kits](/wiki/Medical_kit "Medical kit") can also cure hallucination, though their reliability depends heavily on the hero's role.

The potion of hallucination also has a less fringe benefit: asking a shopkeeper to [uncurse an item](/wiki/Shopkeeper_services#Uncursing "Shopkeeper services") while hallucinating has a chance of [blessing](/wiki/Bless "Bless") it instead, providing a means of doing so without breaking [atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") conduct.

All of the above information also applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the potion of hallucination has some additional possible effects: hallucinating while eating a corpse that grants telepathy adds a point of [insight](/wiki/Insight "Insight"), while quaffing a cursed potion of hallucination reduces the hero's insight by one point. As with SLASH'EM, requesting the item-uncursing service while hallucinating may also cause the item to be blessed instead.

The closet behind the hidden door in the home level of the [Madman quest](/wiki/Madman_quest "Madman quest") has a potion of hallucination in its pile of items.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [the Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)") has a 2⁄3 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a potion of hallucination.

Drinking a non-cursed potion of hallucination may grant [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") alongside hallucination, which is blocked by sources of hallucination resistance (i.e. wielding Grayswandir); this exercises [wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom") and has a 4⁄9 chance of occurring when quaffing a blessed potion, or a 1⁄6 chance when quaffing an uncursed potion.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the [extraplanar merchants](/wiki/Extraplanar_merchant "Extraplanar merchant") in the [City of Brass](/wiki/City_of_Brass "City of Brass") have a 1⁄2 chance of generating with a potion of hallucination among their additional items.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, the vapors from a broken potion of hallucination cause hallucination for 2-6 turns.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") monsters can be generated with the potion of hallucination as an [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), and will throw them at the hero if possible.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the Oracle has a 2⁄3 chance of generating with a potion of hallucination as in xNetHack.

Quaffing the potion of hallucination also behaves as it does in xNetHack; intelligent monsters can generate with the potion of hallucination as an offensive item and will throw them at the hero if possible, as in EvilHack.

4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1817](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L1817)
